item.title: Kinect's Revenge: Nex Playground Outsells Xbox Hardware In The US
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The conventional wisdom is that Kinect was an albatross on Xbox One, making the system more expensive at launch and taking away resource power. But now, over a decade later, the Kinect-like Nex Playground has outsold Xbox hardware for November in the US, according to Circana.

Nex Playground came in third for hardware units sold last month, outpacing Xbox Series X|S. The only saving grace is that Xbox raked in more dollar sales, as Nex Playground retails for $250 but has been on sale for $200 over the holiday season. Overall, video game hardware sales were pretty bleak, reaching a low not seen since November 1995.

This might not be a total shock for those paying attention. Nex Playground actually outsold every PS5 and Xbox console bundle for a week last month in the US. The cube-shaped console features a camera to track body movements, similar to Kinect. Five games are pre-installed, with the option to purchase a subscription Play Pass for a larger library of games. It's $49 for three months or $89 for a year.

Speaking with IGN, Circana senior director Mat Piscatella noted that the Nex Playground has been a "remarkable story" recently. "There could be a lesson here that more affordable, family-friendly gaming devices carry appeal during holiday gifting season," Piscatella added.

On the software side, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 was the best-selling game last month in the US. However, the FPS faced a double-digit percentage decrease compared to 2024's Black Ops 6, and Battlefield 6 is the top-selling game for 2025 to date.

item.title: Fallout 76 Is Free Now On PS5 And Xbox Series X|S, But Only For A Week
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Looking for something new to play? Fallout 76 is available now on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S for free, but only for a limited time. Bethesda has announced that the online RPG is now completely free to download and play through December 23. The freebie offer is not available on PC.

Additionally, Bethesda has announced that Fallout 76's paid membership, Fallout 1st, is getting a free trial through December 23 as well. The Fallout 1st Limited Preview Trial, as it's called, can be claimed through Fallout 76's in-game Atomic Shop right now.

During the trial, players can get a taste of the membership's perks for free. Some of the perks include a 10% boost to S.C.O.R.E., along with an Aid Box for keeping healing items safe, and the Survival Tent, which allows players to fast travel while on the road. The trial membership also includes access to the Scrapbox, which gives players unlimited crafting-supply storage.

After December 23, players will need to subscribe to Fallout 1st to retain the benefits. The membership normally costs $13/month or $100/year.

Bethesda is making Fallout 76 and the Fallout 1st membership free just as Prime Video's Fallout TV show returned for its second season on December 16.

For more, be sure to read GameSpot's breakdown of Fallout Season 2, Episode 1 and our rundown of all the Easter eggs in Episode 1.

Looking further out, Bethesda is developing Fallout 5, and it may be influenced by the TV show.

item.title: Fallout 5 May Be Influenced By The TV Show
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fallout 5 is one of the games currently in the works at Bethesda Game Studios. It's still years away from release, but now Bethesda boss Todd Howard has shared a small update about it.

He told the BBC that Fallout 5 will be influenced in part by the popular Prime Video Fallout TV show. "In short, yes," he said. "Fallout 5 will be existing in a world where the stories and events of the show happened or are happening. We are taking that into account."

Fallout 76 has also been influenced by the TV series, and it gets new content based on the show, including Walton Goggins' character, The Ghoul. That game is free to play now through December 22, presumably to cash in on the debut of Fallout Season 2.

Bethesda first revealed Fallout 5 back in 2022, saying it would be released after The Elder Scrolls VI. There is no word yet on when that game will be released, so fans should get very comfortable for Fallout 5. It's not coming out anytime soon.

Earlier this month, Bethesda said Fallout was the franchise that the developer was "doing the most in."

"We've had a long-term plan for Fallout, and so I wish I could talk about all those today," Howard told IGN. "I'll just say this: It's the franchise that we're doing the most in right now."

In the BBC interview, Howard also discussed how he's happy that the Fallout TV show on Prime Video can help introduce more people to the world of Fallout.

"There's still so many people that won't play a game--I think that's getting better but there's still people who are intimidated," he said. "They still get to experience Fallout and I think that's really important because they're now equal fans of the world."

Beyond Fallout 5, it's rumored that Bethesda is working on a remaster of Fallout 3.
